Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: 2fromthewack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Lion Hotel doing a reverse Park & Fly. It was only 5-7 minutes from the airport and upon returning the shuttle was there in a matter of a few minutes. The room was very clean and my wife still talks about how comfortable the bed was. Coffee maker in the room for her morning coffee. The only thing I would like to see is with the price they offer their package for we get a Continental breakfast. Others in the vicinity are cheaper but offer the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service & Convenient Parking”
Reviews.Author: Flute_Teacher
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for a reverse park & fly. MasterPark runs the parking and it was very quick and convenient. Shuttle was very fast picking us up at SEA. Hotel room was large, overlooked a small lake, and was surprisingly quiet for so close to airport and on busy street. Very clean, but freezing cold. Couldn't get the heat to work & I was too cold in the night to get up, go to the phone & call. Front desk was apologetic in the morning and very polite at check in. Breakfast next door was very good - great staff. Will probably stay here again, but will make sure the heat in the room is working before we go to bed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jonnygecko
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the SeaTac Red Lion many times over the years because it is so convenient for early departures and Master Park parking. Recently we arrived after a long flight, and we're put into room 129. I wanted to change rooms immediately, but we were so tired we just stayed. The carpet was stained, the furniture was stained, the bathroom floor was ice cold, and the door around the lock looked like it had been jimmied from the inside. When we checked out the desk clerk didn't even ask if everything was ok. Avoid room 129. It would be nice when you have a repeat customer you give them the BEST room available. I many re- think my choice for my next visit to Sea Tac Red Lion!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: born to t
Reviews.Content: The "whirlpool" was locked for no apparent reason when we went downstairs. After they unlocked it, we got in and the water was freezing cold and there was dirt and dead skin settled to the bottom as if they hadn't been running it in days. The bathroom was so disgusting. There was dried throw up on the wall still and somebodys booger stuck to the wall. The room is decent. Beds comfortable. Overall impression? This hotel is dirty and cheap. No parking thanks to the bar next door even though we paid ten dollar plus tax PER NIGHT for parking. Definitely wishing I could get my money back....

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: jeff j
Reviews.Content: I must say that the Red Lion was more than I had expected it to be. Ihave stayed there 3 times this year and must say I haven't felt more comfortable any where else.The front desk folks were fantastic. The room was wonderful and very large for what I paid.I really must say i loved being there. When ever I visit Seattle, this is the place for me. Keep up the great work.

Reviews.Title: “I travel 50% of the time, this hotel provided the best night sleep I've ever had while away.”
Reviews.Author: Jetvickers
Reviews.Content: Red Lion offered an amazing value, clean and comfortable, super beds. I usually stay within my reward programs with Choice, or Hilton, but due to an early flight I chose this hotel due to its location to SeaTac. Best Travel Decision Ever, this hotel is a standout!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheJets0ns
Reviews.Content: The Red Lion Hotel was convenient to Sea-Tac and very good in every respect ~ we'd definitely stay there again. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, our room was quiet and comfortable and we appreciated the free shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “great and pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: sayitstr8
Reviews.Content: hotel far exceeded my expectations in every regard. Brian at the front desk offered friendly, efficient and helpful accommodation re parking place, since I cannot walk more than half a block, was this was very relieving. He had an 'of course I'll do everything I can' attitude and I appreciate this greatly. He also made sure I had a very quiet room, which I made clear I needed. So, I could have been seen as a "problem guest", but instead was seen as a valued guest whom he could help. Great service by this young man. also, we used the 14 day parking offer which made this room incredibly inexpensive, especially given what we received per the above paragraph. great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel very convenient to SEATAC Airport”
Reviews.Author: T98383
Reviews.Content: Good hotel very convenient to SEATAC Airport with free shuttle bus. Shuttle seems to be operated by a company that serves several hotels in the area. Shuttle buses have a letter on them that indicates which hotels they serve. Be sure to get the letter code from the hotel desk for the bus that will pick you up from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Sarah J
Reviews.Content: Easy access to the airport. Reasonably priced. Clean rooms, nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fair deal for an enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Minimus0
Reviews.Content: Fabulous staff, friendly and helpful. We were a party of 7 with 3 rooms. Pool was nice and cleanly. Deck area with chairs, loungers & tables was very convenient and a bonus. Parking was fair, close to building and tons of space. Would definately stay again .

Reviews.Title: “Great Park,Stay & Fly option.”
Reviews.Author: HScottP
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the Red Lion that was packaged with 10 days of parking. At $145 (incl. tax) it seems like a pretty good deal. It definitely helped the following morning when we had to catch a 6am flight. The room was clean & comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Early Morning Flight”
Reviews.Author: jrbosco
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Airport Red Lion many times when we have an early flight out the next morning. It is clean, comfortable and convenient. The staff is always friendly and courteous. We had the Fly/Park package and it worked out great!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erik M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business, but wouldn't be my first choice. The hotel rooms need to be updated, and with so many other hotel chains in the area offering free breakfast, I think Red Lion should do the same. On the plus side - Instead of waiting for a shuttle, you can just walk to this hotel from the airport. About a 5-10 minute walk, directly across the street. For an overnight stay, it's okay.

Reviews.Title: “great park and fly program”
Reviews.Author: Katherine B
Reviews.Content: The Red Lion at SeaTac offers a great park and fly experience. Right next to the airport, great service, beautiful rooms, wifi. Drop your car off at MasterPark at the hotel just before you fly. Its waiting for you when you return. We stayed the night before we flew, were gone two weeks, came back after the typical airport experiences. Our car was waiting for us. We got in, drove off. Couldn't be better. Phoebe

Reviews.Title: “Overnight to and from Costa Rica”
Reviews.Author: waterskibabe47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Lion on our way to and home from Costa Rica. The room was perfect. Beds were comfortable and the airport shuttle service was great. It runs 24/7 and the hotel is only about 5 min from the airport. We left our car for 2 weeks and when we went to leave the battery was dead. They had a portable booster and we were on our way in no time. The restaraunt next door is very good and gives you a discount on the breakfast buffet. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience.”
Reviews.Author: PaulTheTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a quick overnight stay at the SEA airport. Rooms were much nicer than I expected. Front desk was friendly. Even though it is close enough to walk to the SEA airport, the shuttle runs so often, it was a breeze (even at 4:30a!). I travel to SEA often, and now have a new place to stay at the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Room looks nice, HVAC a nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: GeekyMomma
Reviews.Content: Our room was very nice looking. Cleanliness was average. Needed some dusting. The biggest problem is that the room's thermostat was very archaic and obviously not working. The room was set at 75 degrees for 5 hours while we were out and came back to a freezing cold room. Turned up the heat to 85, still no heat two hours later. Then we gave up went to sleep. Woke up to a blazing hot room. Tried to turn the heat down and it wouldn't shut off until we set it to 60 degrees. Next day we turned the thermostat up to 70 and came back to a blazing hot room. It had to be over ninety and couldn't get the heat to shut off. Ended up opening the window, but it only opened a bit and we couldn't get any air in the room. The water also goes from cold to blazing hot, no in between and if someone turns on or off the water from another room, you risk getting burned. I was really glad we were not traveling with our children as we couldn't have safely given them a quick shower if needed. Also, the front desk dropped the ball. We called down on New Year's Eve just after midnight to ask for replacement batteries or a remote and they said they would try to find someone to bring us new batteries and nothing was done. No phone call saying they didn't have any extra batteries and no one would be coming. They just didn't respond. It would have been nice to know if they were coming or not.

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnite stay”
Reviews.Author: shanks123
Reviews.Content: I had gone on an official visit to seattle in Late August for an ship visit in cherry point . After a very long flight from India to US by air france , The flight was very good , still due to jet lag wanted to stay overnite before the official visit , One of my friend suggested red lion hotel just outside the Tacoma airport . It is hardly a 10 minutes drive from the airport and infact the airport can be seen from the hotel . The hotel was very clean and after a such a long flight I had no other option but to sleep , the room was very comfortable and the value for money is very much there in this hotel . Food was average , may be beacuse of my taste as an indian and breakfast was good .

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: pascalpierre
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Lion back in late October. The place is really easy to find, just outside the Airport. You can walk from the terminal in just 10 minutes. The Light Train going downtown is about 700 yards away and that makes it really easy to get around. The hotel itself is OK, but the room I had was huge! King bed, coffee and bathroom. Very nice considering the price I paid. I hab booked via ratestogo and my room was under $75 a night. The front desk personel is helpfula nd very friendly and there is a computer in the lobby. Breakfast is to be taken next door and the buffet costs under $10/person. I would certainly stay at that hotel if I come back despite being a bit far from downtown . Nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: tjkinney
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel during my brief stay this week. The room was very clean and the bed was perfectly comfortable. Every staff member was very pleasant and accomodating. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a place to stay in Seattle that is by the airport. The only criticism I have is the parking. The parking lot is small and several spaces are roped off for some reason. The hotel charges to park, but it does not seem that the fee guarantees you'll get a space.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: craig_traveler
Reviews.Content: Older looking property literally across the street from Sea-Tac Airport. Staff very nice and professional. Rooms are modern and redone with with modern conveniences including microwave and fridge. Free in-room wifi and flat screen TV's. Parking is $10/day outside. Overall a very pleasant stay and recommended for early a.m. flights.

Reviews.Title: “The friendly staff made this hotel a great place to overnight.”
Reviews.Author: dnkpowell
Reviews.Content: We were stranded unexpectedly in Seattle without any of our luggage (the luggage apparently went one direction and we went the other!). The front desk clerk was amazing. She found us toothbrushes, toothpaste, deodorant and other necessary items. The room was pleasantly clean and inviting. I would recommend the Red Lion for overnight stays in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “If you can't REST, nothing else matters...”
Reviews.Author: Zacher
Reviews.Content: Firstly, let me say that the staff were unfailingly pleasant and accommodating. The problem with this hotel is the dilapidated state of the building. The carpets are stained, a/c grills are filthy, lampshades dingy and crooked, paint chipped, etc. These things aren't necessarily deal-breakers by themselves, but overall they end up making you wonder about the cleanliness of the bedding, etc. I neglected to ask for a non-smoking room at check-in, as I've become complacent, assuming that all hotels these days are non-smoking throughout. The 3rd floor is a smoking floor, and the corridor REEKS of smoke, so avoid that floor is you mind. I switched to the 4th floor after my first night, and it's smoke-odor free. Both rooms I had have the same problems: VERY thin walls (you can hear which song your neighbor's clock radio is playing when his alarm goes off at 5am), and VERY, VERY loud plumbing! I mean, when someone else turns on the shower, or flushes their loo, the abrupt torrent of water noise will wake you from a dead sleep. This noise is so loud that it makes conversation difficult in the room, and requires you to turn up the TV! I'm seriously not a very picky person about hotel rooms (I'm a pilot, I stay in hundreds), but trust me, this is not a restful experience. Oh, and the thin walls? Well, this is an AIRPORT hotel, and you may mind airplane noise a bit more than I do! :) Other, more minor issues: the wifi was sometimes very slow, and the showers are quite weak, and if the hotel is in "heating" mode, rather than "a/c" mode, your only option to keep your room cool for the night will be to open your window (see above re: airport hotel).. I got a pretty cheap price on this hotel, and it was no bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: Tri-fan-couple
Reviews.Content: The Red Lion was a good choice for the one night we were in Seattle: close to the airport and comfortable beds. One thing we noticed immediately about the hotel was how dirty the carpeting was in the front lobby area. I mean, seriously disgusting, but I realize they get a lot of traffic in and out. Our rooms were on the first floor and it was frigid on the entire floor and with no good explanation other than the hotel was saving a buck on heating costs. Fortunately, our rooms had thermostats, but the heat wasn't on in any of the rooms. We promptly turned ours up quite high to heat the ENORMOUS room we had. We could have played a game of touch Football in there. The room finally warmed up sometime in the night. The bathrooms were nice and it appeared that the tile had recently been replaced. However, one very noticeable thing missing were any form of grab-bars in the shower. We were traveling with my grandmother so this was a concern of ours. We didn't make a change as we had checked in rather late in the evening but were surprised the bars were not standard. The following morning, we ate at the attached cafe and it was horrible! The coffee and juice were horrendous, the service was sub-par and the breakfast food was so-so.

Reviews.Title: “Red Lion is Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Riki M
Reviews.Content: I am a giant fan of Red Lion Hotels. The beds are amazing, the rooms are always very clean, all the details of the rooms are great, and every staff member I have spoken with has been great. I stayed at the Tacoma one there two years ago while passing through and, literally, ever since, have been wishing that every hotel was like the Red Lions. I was glad rooms were available for this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Red Lion Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HawaiianWoman
Reviews.Content: Loved this place is SO clean great service we were there for a night before a trip they bring you your vehicle to the door under the covered entrance & they park it for you.

Reviews.Title: “Always My First Choice at Seatac”
Reviews.Author: unionjack1
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed here for about 5 years. In the past it has always been my hotel of choice, As always it lived up to what I have always expected from Red Lion. Friendly staff, a comfortable room and a good reastaurant. We ate dinner and breakfast at Gregory's and were well satisfied. For the price there is no better hotel at the Seattle Airport than Red Lion and we've stayed at many of them. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMG007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2011 after about two years of absence. Nothing has changed much, not for the worse but also not for the better. Place could use sn upgrade. Room was ok, very spacious. Breakfast facilities are meager. BF is not included and the sstuff their small shop is selling is so and so. No decent place to sit. Check In / Check out is legendarily inefficient. Also, they don't care too much about the HHonors "gold" status a customer might have. WiFi is free of charge in the lobby but not in the rooms. Would recommend this hotel only for a quick transfer between flights due to its proximity to SeaTac and free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: becky v
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to stay at the Red Lion Hotel in Seattle. I actually had originally booked a different property, but found the room unsatisfactory. Walking into the Red Lion i knew instantly I selected the right place. I was greeted by smiling helpful personnel. The accommodations were comfortable, clean and cozy. I travel a lot on business and this stay was so pleasing...I hated to leave. I strongly recommend you giving this hotel a try. It's really close to the airport and the shuttle service ran on schedule coming and going!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Stress Free”
Reviews.Author: Judy H
Reviews.Content: Even though we live not far from the airport, we always use the Sleep and Fly for early flights. The staff, hotel and parking, are very helpful, check-in the night before a flight is a breeze, we've never had a bad meal at the restaurant, and the shuttle to the airport makes it easy, without our typical last minute rushing around. A pleasant way to start a trip. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Chirogirl08
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel EVERY TIME I have business near SeaTac. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and VERY clean. The hotel staff is extremely attentive and make check in and out a breeze! The restaurant has great food. Drinks in the lounge are a little pricey but again the service is superb!

Reviews.Title: “Getting old looking”
Reviews.Author: niner42
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year and wouldn't stay again. The hotel seemed to be getting a little run down and it started to feel old. The staff was good but there are nicer hotels nearby...

Reviews.Title: “Fly and park special”
Reviews.Author: ronvoyage
Reviews.Content: My honey and I stayed one night in room 520 and then parked the car for 14 days at the Red Lion Hotel at SEATAC airport near Seattle. What a deal! Check out the Red Lion website for their specials and the park and fly packages. The rooms at this Red Lion are very spacious and the bed is the best. The outstanding breakfast is served at the restaurant next to the hotel and can be included in your room rate. Free wifi with a strong connection is part of the services offered at the hotel. The staff at the front desk are eager to help. There is a new Subway restaurant across the street from the hotel and one block south for a quick and reasonable meal. Great location immediately across the street from SEATAC that can be walked in under 10 minutes from the terminal. Free airport shuttle is also offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport location”
Reviews.Author: CougRN
Reviews.Content: This is a great spot to stay before flying or for meetings that require people to fly in for. It is literally right across the street from the airport and you can walk from baggage claim to the hotel within 10 minutes. I stayed for a business meeting and the event planning staff were great to work with. Very attentive and added some personal touches for members of our group. The hotel is in the process of being renovated and updated. It is a very clean, comfortable hotel. The beds are comfortable, the rooms are spacious, clean and the amenities include soaps from Bath & Bodyworks. The Roaring Start breakfast has a fairly good selection and if you would rather order off the menu, there are fresh options available. The rate was good for the Seattle area - especially in the summer - however, this may have been a group rate. My family traveled with me and my son (12 year old) absolutely loved the staff and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Way cheaper than downtown”
Reviews.Author: PoOr_man73
Reviews.Content: Even though it is close to the airport the noise didn't bother me at all. The walls do seem to a be a bit thin though, and I heard a few people running in the hall. Also, when the guests in the next room took a shower it was fairly loud. It didn't bother me, but if you are a light sleeper it could be an issue. It's just a short walk to the Link light rail which will get you downtown in about half an hour for just a few bucks each way. In my opinion that short travel time is totally worth the money you save vs staying in a hotel downtown. The breakfast buffet (additional charge) at the restaurant was very similar to what you would get for free at a Hampton Inn, but it was decent. A lot of hotels have and 11:00 check out time, but the Red Lion lets you stay until Noon, which was really nice. They also let me check in at 1:30 although check in time isn't until 3:00 Overall I was quite satisfied with my stay, and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location to the airport for early flight”
Reviews.Author: eagles78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Lion to be near the airport due to early flight the next morning. It was large,clean rooms. Our carpet was wet due to a leak coming from the next room. Called front desk and we were moved to new room within 5 minutes. The room they moved us to was same kind just different floor. Very quick to take care of things.

Reviews.Title: “Extreme Convenience”
Reviews.Author: fancher04
Reviews.Content: We had a couple of days to wait for our car to be delivered in Seattle before driving to Eastern Washington and decided to stay at the Red Lion because it was close to the airport and the Light Rail. We were very happy to find out that there were also quite a few decent restaurants all within 2-3 blocks.We were able to walk everywhere we needed to before we got our car and we had a little refrigerator and microwave in opur room. All for less than $100.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further”
Reviews.Author: Sareilly
Reviews.Content: For a mid-range airport stopover, this is a terrific choice. Close to airport, very clean, large, comfortable rooms with fridge and super-comfy beds, nice outdoor pool & indoor hot tub, and a bountiful, good quality, all-you-can-eat breakfast buffet next door for about $8. I simply can't think of anything wrong with it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: OceanIbis
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried when we pulled into the parking lot, as this hotel is so very close to the airport. But our first-floor room, which looked out into the parking lot, was quiet; I only heard a little noise from the hallway or a neighboring shower. The bed was above-average in comfort for a hotel bed, and all the linens were nice and fresh. The pillows were rather overstuffed but I managed to squish one down to a usable size. The comforter was, alas, the somewhat scratchy kind popular in most hotels. The shower area looked quite nice with actual tile and it was absolutely spotless, even in the corners. The shower-head was a large, non-mobile type with many little streams of water, and the hot water was impressively hot. As of August 2011, the wi-fi was free, fast, and stable. Breakfast is included for free in some packages; if not, you can pay $9. It is served in the restaurant next door, and included breads, fruit, yogurt, cereal, bacon, eggs, sausage and hash browns. Oh, and best of all, they have a pancake printer - that's right, it 'prints' fresh pancakes right onto your plate off a little conveyor belt! Parking is $10 a night. I don't like to pay to park, but it is several dollars cheaper than the neighboring pay to park lots. Oh, and I can't say for sure as I didn't explore the whole hotel, but I don't think there is a laundry room. They do have laundry service. It's clean, it's quiet, and it's ridiculously close to the airport and the light rail station. This time of year is when all the construction is done because it's dry, so driving a car around is even more of a pain than usual; if you are up for the walk, taking the train might make your visit more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Hawtrip07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel only one night. The lobby and front desk did not give a very good first impression. The room seems outdated and it needs a makeover. There's a charge for Internet use, no free breakfast, $2.00 for a bottle of water in the room( brought a big case at target for $3.00), Doesn't seem safe in the surrounding area, can hear loud plumbing noise in the morning. However, parking is $10.00/night, free shuttle to mall across from hotel, hotel is very close to airport, less than 5 minutes drive, the bed was firm.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, convenient to Seatac”
Reviews.Author: kimbaroni
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the night before my flight back to Europe. I'd been traveling for three weeks and needed a quiet, restful night and that's exactly what I got. I don't have a clue what amenities they offer other than free, robust wifi, but I can tell you I slept very well and took an incredible shower, and that the airport is very close by (yet no jet noise). If you need an airport hotel in Seatac, you can't do better.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Barb_MiamiSprings
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Red Lion for the past three years on my way to and from Alaska. I originally chose it for its proximity to the Seattle Airport, but now that is only one of the reasons that I stay there when I pass through town. First, the hotel is literally across the street from the Seattle Airport, and the hotel shuttle picks you up incredibly promptly once you give them a quick call from the curbside courtesy phone. Believe me, I have waited much, much longer for some other hotel shuttles. The hotel itself is clean, quiet and very comfortable, with all the necessary toiletries and electronic hook-ups that we all rely on these days. I travel alone most of the time so I really appreciate the fact that my requests (which I have made ahead of time with the hotel) for a room on an upper floor are always accommodated, unlike some other hotels near this airport that I have stayed with in the past where a few front desk clerks seemed incredibly put-out by my request. I also think that it is very reasonably priced. My flights always seem to arrive either very early or very late when the restaurant next door is closed, so I appreciate the little snack-for-purchase area that is located right next to the front counter. This past trip I again arrived very late and decided to take advantage of the restaurant,13 Coins, that is literally two parking lots away and is open 24 hours a day. It's a safe, short walk to good food. The staff has always been courteous and very efficient. And when I have had time to go into downtown Seattle they have been able to answer all my questions concerning transit to and from Seattle. As long as my travels bring me through the Seattle Airport, I will be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “same as always . . . wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: desenglishmedia
Reviews.Content: Dear Shawn Darling and Team at the Red Lion Hotel Seattle Airport, Thanks for the nice stay there! Your team really knows how to make travelers feel at home! We stay there regularly, as it makes it so convenient. At the Red Lion, you can 'relax the night before traveling, get up feeling great and ready to go'! The whole team working there shows their 'true joy' for serving customers. You all do it great. Again, thanks. Warm greetings, Dean Stewart, Sr., BA, President, Voice Artist 'Reaching Voice Media Goals on a Global Basis' D.E.S. English Media Services http://www.desenglishmedia.com Registered in Washington State USA

Reviews.Title: “We're never suprised...always excellent.”
Reviews.Author: David_S2009
Reviews.Content: Getting around in Seattle requires a solid base and this property meets or exceeds all expectations. It's across the street from the airport, is close to I-5 and is on a major regional highway, as well as within walking distance to the new monorail to the downtown core. The front desk staff are always courteous and efficient getting us in and out and they certainly know the area and can make good recommendations. The rooms are large, well-appointed, quiet in spite of proximity to the airport and kept very clean. Gregory's, immediately adjacent provides a hearty breakfast and is a grand place to chat with folks over a cocktail. We often travel with our greyhound and are made to feel very comfortable with our pet. I gladly make this my base of operations whenever I'm in the Seattle area.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: KatiDot
Reviews.Content: We had to pay for parking our car becasue we were not a memeber of the hotel chain. The pillows on the bed were not very comfortable and bed was hard. It was ok for a one nigth stay but I would not go back if I am in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful service and a relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Woolfoot
Reviews.Content: I am writing from room 322 the night before our checkout after a two-night stay. I am C=coming to you via the free internet at the hotel which was greatly appreciated. (We stayed downtown early in the trip at a snazzier hotel that charged for internet...) We got here yesterday, worn out from an Alaska cruise. It was only about 10 AM but the nice woman at the desk let us check in and it made a huge difference to us - we got a day in Seattle without a period of homelessness! It's a typical airport hotel but the room is big and clean and the staff has been very helpful - posting some cards for me and generally being friendly. Best of all was the coin-op laundry near the lobby so I could wash all those cruise clothes (the rates for laundry on board were out of sight). We'll take the hotel shuttle to the airport early in the AM. (You could throw a stone to the airport from here so it should be fast.) FYI - it's a 10 minute (or so) walk to the light rail that serves the airport from here. It was easy to get to downtown on the light rail for not much $$ and we saw a Mariner's game yesterday using the rail and went back in today to see Harry Potter at the fabulous Cinerama downtown (a _great_ movie palace). Several restaurants in walking distance. I was glad I didn't rent a car on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and convenient to the airport!”
Reviews.Author: tomsuelaw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally right accross the street from SEA-TAC. I mean this in a good way. The hotel offers a 24hour shuttle service where shuttles leave every 6-8min. The hotel is located within walking distance of most of the rental car companies so you can return your car early, save on parking, and not have to bother with it the day of your return flight. Our room was clean and very comfortable. The mattress was very high qulaity and very comfortable (soft). Hotel staff very nice. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. Highly recomend this hotel if you need something by the airport. Got this hotel on priceline when bidding on 3 star hotel for $85

Reviews.Title: “Near airport--that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Devon11
Reviews.Content: Very close to airport with a free shuttle that leaves frequently. Property is very dated and old. Room was clean. The pool is outdoors and behind the restaurant. It didn't look too clean to me and needed some work. Good price for room, though so just fine if you want to be at the airport quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Seattle airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichVolk
Reviews.Content: We used to stay at the Red Lion Seattle Airport (formerly West Coast) hotel when flying from our NJ home to Seattle. A year ago we moved to Washington state and have now used it for Park and Fly packages when we fly from Seattle on vacation. The rooms are always neat and clean and the staff treats guests well. Usually we arrive in the early evening when we have early flights the next day. We usually go to Gregory's restaurant for dinner and have been very satisfied with the selection and prices of dinner entrees. We have not tried breakfast at Gregory's because we are usually in a hurry to get to the airport for our departing flights. We did stay once at another hotel on a Park and Fly package, but it was not as comfortable as Red Lion. The Red Lion is our first choice for staying at SeaTac airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good rooms, GREAT breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jraja123
Reviews.Content: Good quality room and AMAZING free breakfast, friendly and helpful staff, half hr drive from downtown seattle, 2 mts to the aport, free wifi and business centre and free printing, overall amazing! recommended! no free parking however

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jvenneberg
Reviews.Content: We frequently stay overnight before we fly out early. We have stayed at several places. This was better than I expected. Very quiet, very comfortable beds. I was pleasantly surprised. We did the park and fly. Very convenient. We would stay here again. As a side note, we have stayed at other Red Lions with our dog and they are very accomodating. If you join their frequent stayed plan( which we are not) the dog stays free!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: palmderosa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Lion because of the great deal they offered us. We took a 7 day Alaska Cruise on Princess and stayed at the Red Lion the night before and parked our car for 7 days. I wish we had come in a few days earlier, because the hotel was just beautiful. Every staff member went above and beyond to make our visit one to remember. The decor is top shelf and the rooms were very large and beautifully appointed. Thank you Red Lion for starting our vacation of a lifetime on such a positive note. We will be returning!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rated a 3 star -- should be 2 or less”
Reviews.Author: Jaxattack
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful.. from the staff to the rooms... let me start off by saying that we had to move to 3..yes I repeat 3 different rooms.. why you ask.. well let me tell you.. the first room we didnt get any sleep in because the ac kept making a very loud rattling noise all night and we were sweating by the end of the night.. ends up that the ac was busted..so we requested a room change.. it took a while but we got another room.. packed all our stuff back up and headed there only to find out they gave us the wrong room key.. so we had to go back downstairs.. so they gave us a different room.. well the air still rattled and to make it worse the tv didnt work.. when the engineer came out he told us that the room they gave us was a downgraded room and that they only give those rooms to "free guest".. so we packed up our stuff again and moved to another room.. after all this we asked for a price adjustment on our stay.. the least that they could do.. but noooooo they offered us a free continental breakfast.. yes the free breakfast that you usually get at other hotels they charge 7.99 here.. so we got compensated with a continental breakfast.. then they couldnt get that right because they didnt have us on the "free breakfast list" I had enough.. I went to the front desk and ask for a manager. When I didnt think things could get worse said that there was no manager on duty and sent a chef from the continental breakfast over to talk with me.. he said he was in charge.. are you serious??.. they wouldnt call the manager or offer any type of an apology.. it was the worst hotel experience ever.. would never ever stay at a Red Lion Hotel or anything associated with them..

Reviews.Title: “Great for an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: boomertraveler54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we were leaving Seatac very early. The price was right and the room was big. We heard nothing, right across the street from the airport. 13 Coins is a short walk away, and while we had planned to walk over to the airport, a shuttle was waiting as we walked out the door. We boarded. He left, and we were at the airport in about 5 minutes. We will definitely stay here again for early morning flights.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Nettie96797
Reviews.Content: Spent only one night at the Red Lion Airport on our way to Cruise ship...but was impressed with the friendliness of the desk clerks and cleanliness of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service - great location”
Reviews.Author: LeisureTravelTime_WA
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at other hotels near SeaTac for their "Park and Fly" packages. Terrible! But, the Red Lion outshines them all! Incredible staff, courteous, efficient with great attitudes. Check-in is less than 3 minutes total, check-out was less than 10 seconds, the Master Park Valet service attached to this hotel is incredibly quick. When we arrived at SeaTac, the shuttle van picked us up in less than 4 minutes, had our car waiting for us, and off we went. Rooms are HUGE! Beds are so comfortable - work desk is large and just the right height. Small fridge, coffee maker, flat screen TV, big bathroom, black-out curtains. Some noise from the other room, but they are soon going to be fixing that, so sleeping will not be a problem any more. HIGHLY recommend this Red Lion if staying near SeaTac, and to take advantage of the Park and Fly packages. We are travel agents and travel a lot, and this is by far one of the best Park and Fly hotels out there!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific park and fly value”
Reviews.Author: rehorsman
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit to the easy coast, and live about 60 miles from the Seattle-Tacoma airport. To get to east coast destinations in anything approaching a reasonable hour, I must leave Seattle at 6 or 7 AM. With current tradffic, I would have to be out of the house by 2 AM; which means I don't sleep at all. I have found a far better solution. I make a 'park and fly' reservation at the Red Lion Hotel Seattle Airport. It is directly across the street from the airport. Rooms are clean and spacious and comfortable. The price of the reservation includes not only my one night stay at the hotel (with wake up call so as to catch my plane), but four days of parking in their secured parking lot (Masterpark lot A). There is an excellent restaurant right next door, although my spouse is particularly fond of the vegetable fritatta at 13 Coins restaurant, which is a 50 yard walk. Come in the night before, check in your car, check into your room, have a civilized and tasty dinner, and avoid the pressure and crush of the early morning commute before your plane. Sounds like a win/win situation to me. Rick Horsman Olympia, WA Front desk staff are pleasant and professionalk, even at 4 AM

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-cruise Hotel Near Seatac”
Reviews.Author: c21bill
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our flight left for Vancouver BC to begin our Alaska cruise. The hotel has a Stay & Park program so we had a place to leave our car for the week we were gone. The hotel is well located, clean and up to date. Our room was very large and comfortable. We had to leave too early to take advantage of the free breakfast but from the pictures it looked yummy. They also provide free 24 hour airport shuttle. Very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay. Very pet friendly and extremely great with Military families.”
Reviews.Author: USMCwife06
Reviews.Content: My husband, our pet, and I stayed here a couple days ago and it was a great "welcome back to the states from Japan." Everyone that worked at the hotel are very helpful,friendly,and professional. The restaurant next door has really delicious food. Even though the menu said cheeseburger I had asked if they could make it to a mushroom Swiss burger instead and they did without any problems. It was one of the tastiest Mushroom Swiss burgers I have ever had in my life. The ribs are also a must to try!! I wanted to Thank Kara for her outstanding customer service at the front desk. She was very kind and helpful to us. Thank you so much Red Lion Inn for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “The price via Priceline was good for us!”
Reviews.Author: scorprincess
Reviews.Content: We purchased via Priceline.com as a "NAME YOUR PRICE", but overall we liked it, better than the cheap crap we ususlly stay at, close to the new LRT which we used to take us to downtown Seattle, (approx. 40 MINS, $5 return) safe, convenient. Room was clean, big, had a flat screen in it, but we ended up at a ajoining room in which the door to the other room was paper thin, so we could hear them. It was worth the price we paid, except you have to pay for parking when you stay that close to airport. ($10 per night)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay, pet friendly!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay!! All the employees were very nice, room was nice and comfy and within walking distance to some great restaurants. I will definately stay there again. Pet friendly which is very important to me! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Good value but....”
Reviews.Author: rapunzel_elf
Reviews.Content: We were flying out of Seatac at 6am. Instead of waking up at 2:30am to make it to the airport in time we decided to book a room at the Red Lion the night before. Figured it would allow us to get more sleep....boy were we wrong. The hotel itself is clean and the rooms are nice. BUT the need to update their windows. We were kept awake almost all night by the whistling window. I am by no means a light sleeper but the noise was too loud to ignore. I tried everything to get it to stop including opening the window. But due to their age I could not prop open the window. We will not stay here again. Better safe then sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport parking service, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: CC9876
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, right by the airport with 24 hour shuttle, good staff, especially regarding the airport parking (we left our truck here for 10 days). The rooms are decent, but I particularily hated the showerheads, they definitely need to be updated. During one of our stays here, we were in a room that opens into 2 connecting rooms, which was noisy because we could hear our neighbours loudly through the 2 sets of connector doors on the wall. Make sure you don't get one of these rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Comfort”
Reviews.Author: MJAnderson6
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the SeaTac Red Lion, taking advantage of their Park & Fly program. We live over an hour from the airport & had an early morning flight so went over the night before. Our main purpose for chosing them was the convenience of leaving our car for the two weeks in a safe place for the 2 weeks we'd be gone & the Park & Fly rate is very affordable. There is also a nice restaurant (Gregory's) right next door. The front desk staff were very efficient and courteous. But the nicest surprise of all was the unbelievable comfortable beds and pillows! We travel quite a lot but we have never slept in such amazing beds. The minute I layed down, I felt like I was tucked away in a wonderful, fluffy cloud. It was heaven and I got the most wonderful night's sleep. We will definitely stay there when traveling in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us...”
Reviews.Author: Jaye05
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel that not only was close to the airport but also provided long term parking. We ended up getting much more. Due to the large size of our vehicle (truck) a large parking spot was required. The employees at the front desk went out of their way to make sure an ample spot was provided. We also felt very comfortable leaving our truck for a week as the Red Lion works in conjunction with a separate well known parking/garage service; thus, 24-hour security was provided. I cannot say enough about the friendliness of the front desk personnel and their willingness to assist. The rooms themselves are a bit dated but very clean and - who cares? - we were simply looking for a good night's rest before our 5am flight. The Red Lion also offers a free/5 minute shuttle to/from SeaTac.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, service and accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: cheryltapp
Reviews.Content: The beds are the best! And you can walk to the hotel from the airport. Staff is courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, walking distance to airport”
Reviews.Author: Fortenberry
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, stay here every time we come to SeaTac

Reviews.Title: “A hop, skip & jump from Sea-Tac Airport & Very Dog Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jerrysusan
Reviews.Content: Ideally located and recommended for a night or two at Sea-Tac Airport. We were picking up our new puppy, Chase, after his 12 hour trip from the eastcoast. This was a great place to stay. Five minutes from the airport, spacious rooms, a good quality restaurant next door that provided take-out, and a friendly staff who made us and our puppy welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Red Lion Hotel Seattle Airport - Value, Convenience, and an "at home" feeling.”
Reviews.Author: JWVT
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been a regular layover spot for my personal and business needs for more than 15 years. The ownership changed a few years ago to the Red Lion but they kept the culture of the property and continue to make improvements for their guests. Conviently located right outside the entrance to SEA TAC Airport, shuttle service is available as well as Gregory's Restaurant for full service dining. A #1 for me.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: climbhi2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Seattle Boat Show. Super easy access. Friendly staff. Quiet Hotel. And my dog loved it. Would highly recommend the Red Lion. We have stayed at several and haven't been unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite SeaTac hotel”
Reviews.Author: fromhove
Reviews.Content: We stay here whenever we fly out of SeTac and have always been very happy. Our rooms have been a good size, clean and very comfortable beds. I have a thing about towels and I love the quailty of this hotel's towels. Breakfast was great and substantial. The staff have always been cheerful and most welcoming. Looking forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: DarM_1430
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, clean and great location. Airport p/u and delivery 24 hrs. The room was spacious and well appointed. Bed was one of the best I've slept in and I've stayed at a lot of hotels. Staff was friendly and helpful. Even though it is across the highway from the airport, it was very quiet. Had a great nights sleep All in all, an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel with park and fly options”
Reviews.Author: TiffaniVictoria
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight when flying from Seatac. The park and fly options are economical and so convenient. The shuttles run frequently. Staff were courteous and the rooms and amenities were very good. Right across from the airport, which is the best option for us for a quick night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you need to stay near SEA”
Reviews.Author: CCRR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night. We chose this hotel because we got a fantastic rate and we had a very early morning flight and wanted to stay near the airport. It is extremely close to the airport with a free shuttle. We found the front desk staff professional and courteous. The hotel itself looks a little tired with old elevators. Our room was very spacious and the bed comfortable, but the popcorn ceiling gave it a dated look. We experienced a couple of problems. The first one was the water in the sink area. I was not able to get hot water from the tap. After fiddling around with the knobs below the sink I was finally able to get hot water after waiting about a minute. When I took my shower in the morning the water temperature did fluctuate a bit. Also, and this is unfortunately the reason I will probably not return, the hairdryer was painfully weak. Normally I can dry my hair in five minutes. It took me twenty minutes before my hair was finally dry! Also, the $10.00 self-parking rate, we felt, was a bit too high. Although it seems to be the norm to charge for parking at the other airport hotels in Seattle. We got a really great rate, so I was sort of willing to excuse the problems. However, because of the above issues, this hotel will probably not be my first choice if we need to stay near the airport again.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of service, cleanliness and competence”
Reviews.Author: Irene31020
Reviews.Content: In the world of adequate lodging, this Red Lion is a welcome oasis of service, cleanliness and competence. The staff is friendly and well-organized, and sympathetic to a worn-out traveller (I was traveling to and from Europe). I stayed twice during the month, and the room SPARKLED both times. Bedding was crisp and clean, mattresses were clean (yes, I checked - with the bed bug epidemic I thought it worth a look). There were plenty of clean towels. I did not find a single stray hair in the bathroom - now, business traveller, how often can you say that? The carpets were clean, no sign that there had been a previous guest. I travel quite a bit for business, and these accommodations are far and above the average hotel experience. Another thing that makes this place extremely attractive is its proximity to the airport - it is at the bottom of the ramp and across the road, it is an easy walk. Despite its proximity, it is quiet. As an Alaskan, I usually give myself a day to get out of the state during fall and winter weather, and plan an overnight in SEA before continuing on my journey. This facility is perfectly situated for Alaskans with a similar strategy. It may seem funny to gush over an airport hotel, but this one is worth it. It is a stay to be anticipated rather than endured, a wonderful respite for long trips.

Reviews.Title: “We were treated with excellence, in all ways”
Reviews.Author: desenglishmedia
Reviews.Content: The service was superb. The room was perfect. It was very clean and spacious. The location of the room was excellent. The amenities were conveniently located, providing all our needs. We liked everything, and nothing was lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: angten
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our return home from Hawaii. The hotel is convenient to Sea Tac, has a free shuttle service. Fortunately we were with my sister-in-law and her partner who live in Seattle, otherwise we wouldn't have known how to find the shuttle. The rooms are quite large with tasteful furniture. There are some caveats. The lighting is insufficient, it is hard to find the light switch when walking into a dark room. The bathrooms have been remodeled and are handicapped accessible. The lighting in the bathroom is dim and the towel racks are inconvenient. The room has an alcove for hanging clothes, has no closet door. It makes an otherwise nice room look cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Totally pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: spatten2001
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we have used this hotel - we chose it for the 'Park and Fly' package. It was totally pleasant and wonderful! We spent the night before our flight in a beautifully furnished room -- huge size room and extremely comfortable - almost like being at home! We parked our car with the 'Park and Fly' people and when we arrived back in Seattle 6 days later, gave a call to them from courtesy phone at airport, rode shuttle to the hotel and there was our vehicle w/trunk open waiting for our baggage! Absolutely the best experience of the whole trip! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “It'll do......”
Reviews.Author: katangel4147
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the convenience of this hotel for getting to the airport! I had the same issue as previous reviewers with the noise level, I could clearly hear everything in the next room. It was a family with kids and they weren't being overly noisy but you can still hear everything. The doors are also very noisy opening and shutting all down the hall. My biggest problem was with the bathroom. I got in late and was looking forward to a nice hot bath before bed. There was hair in the tub and the drain did not plug properly. I attempted to call down to the front desk multiple times and was hung up on three times before someone answered the phone. They sent an engineer up to fix the drain quickly but by then I had to go get some sleep, so no hot bath for me. The front desk staff was very helpful but a bit flustered. Love the shuttle service to the airport. Bed was comfortable and the room is spacious. What I really am missing is a continental breakfast. Would be so great to have a grab and go breakfast before heading to the airport. They have a breakfast buffet but you have to go to the adjoining restaurant and pay 8 bucks. Disappointing for a Red Lion, was expecting more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Old, run-down, convenient and polite staff”
Reviews.Author: juliekutty
Reviews.Content: Ancient beds. Thread bare sheets. 20 year old pillow. Musty smell. My husband and daughter were itching all over after a one night stay. Spacious rooms. Neighbors blasted tv till early am. Convenient to airport. Masterpark is onsite. Staff was polite for the most part. They do get inpatient if you ask too many questions.

Reviews.Title: “great welcome to seattle”
Reviews.Author: blah47
Reviews.Content: It was my friends first time every visiting the seattle area and so we had her stay at the Red Lion hotel near the airport. We didn't want her to get to far from her leaving port. We have family that says with the Red Lion quit frequently and love the location. We she arrived at the hotel she was dying for fresh seafood and couldn't check in right away so the girl at the desk had a GREAT recommendation of Salty's restaurant down on the waterfront. She also recommended that we seat out on the desk to take in the view and the "enjoy our lunch". It was a great recommendation! The next day she helped us with finding a tour of the sound and hind on what to do the rest of the time we where in seattle. Brandy at the front desk my friend feel "welcomed" to seattle and the rest of the staff was very welcoming as well.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Dump...and $150”
Reviews.Author: mtcrew
Reviews.Content: I always thought Red Lions had a good reputaion and have had good experiences...this one was different. We got in about 10 PM - the gal checking us in was really nice. The halls really smelled like old smoke enouph that we were worried our room would reek too - luckily it did not.The room was actually OK..but old pieces and parts and A/C didn't work. The place needs updating very low ceilings and the outside is beat up. We missed our departure and need a late checkout..we asked if we could have a little more time - and the gal at the counter (the one with light brown hair in a bun in morning) wouldn't even look up at was very blunt and mean about having to be out at noon, because a number of people were to check-in..and- that we "had the right" to hang out in the lobby or connecting coffee shop. I understand - but the housekeepers had already cleaned a number of rooms so that wasn't the issue...and she wasn't letting people check-in anyway we heard her tell people not until 3PM---so we hung out in lobby with all our Hawaii luggage for an hour until our ride came. We won't stay at Red Lion SeaTac again.. All for $150.00

Reviews.Title: “Nice but loud”
Reviews.Author: Replevin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Red Lion for one night prior to an early morning flight out of SeaTac. The rooms were nice, the staff was very helpful, and the location and the van service to the airport is outstanding. But since we stayed there primarily to get a good night's sleep for our very early getup the noise level was a real drawback. It seemed like we could hear everything that was going on in the hotel. Doors slamming, people talking in the adjacent rooms, kids outside in the pool. And it's not like they were being overly loud, the construction of the building just transmitted noise. I would have a hard time recommending the hotel because of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Chuckerhouse
Reviews.Content: Red Lion Hotel Seattle Airport is just as it says; right across the street from SeaTac. Very convenient accomodation for air travelers. Yet from inside my hotel room, I noticed no airport noise. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Hotel staff polite and helpful. Very affordable value in comparison to similar area hotels. I will definately make this my future hotel of choice when traveling to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “The service was supurb and the beds were so comfortable, it was like lying on a cloud”
Reviews.Author: Dirtdobber22
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels during my 50 year professional life, but I have not found one that surpassed the service quality of the Red Lion Inn at the Seattle Airport.in June, 2010. My extended family (14 of us) was going on a cruise and decided to meet at the Red Lion, spend the night, sightsee the next morning and afternoon and board the ship in early evening. Because we were coming from different locations, I had not made arrangements for luggage transfers with the cruise line, not realized how far away the airport was from Seattle nor what a hassle it would be to keep up with luggage while sightseeing on foot for 9 hours. The entire desk staff at the Red Lion had great suggestions about riding the liight link rail into the city, leaving our luggage at the downtown Red Lion and getting it sent to the pier. Not only did they save us time, and tired backs, but money, too. Oh, yes, at least 10 of the travelers commented on how comfortable the beds were. I started staying at Red Lion in the early 80s in Durango, CO and have never had a bad experience, but this one was outstanding. Thank you, Red Lion, SeaTac!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: molly206
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Lion Seattle Airport 5/20/10. We had an early flight the next morning and this hotel was just perfect. We have stayed here before when we've had an early flight the next morning. As before, our room was a good size and very clean. We had a king bed that was very comfortable. We were on the "quiet floor" and that was wonderful. It was very easy the next morning to take the shuttle to the airport. We will always stay at this hotel whenever we have a early morning flight. It can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place and people.”
Reviews.Author: mountngirlnc
Reviews.Content: Loved Christine at the front desk. Breakfast Buffet great. Room clean and wonderful. Stayed there before and after my cruise. Just across street from airport and easy walk to LINK light rail at airport. Good view of Mt. Ranier from room windows. Restaurant next door, several other restaurants within walking distance. Courtesy shuttle to airport fast. Overall, wonderful. Would stay there again if I go to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Seattle Area”
Reviews.Author: tori_t2u
Reviews.Content: I thought the Red Lion was a great deal, especially if you have AAA. We booked the room through the hotel's website for $85.00 for four, and if you had AAA, they threw in the great buffet breakfast for free--for 4 people! We were there with friends visiting from Nevada. Ok...so it rained the entire month of April, May and June, and rained while we were in Seattle. What else is new? They were great sports, it was a fun trip, and they were very happy with our hotel and the crab rolls they bought on Post Alley in Seattle. The furnishings aren't the fanciest, nor do the rooms have a fridge or microwave, but the room was clean, the staff helpful, and the two queen beds--which are hard to find as most places only have two double beds--were comfortable. The pillows, shaped as squares, were a bit odd, but I slept just fine on them. My friend loves to sing Karaoke so he was happy to see it offered in the lounge on the Saturday night we were there. We found stuffed chairs in the lounge and made ourselves comfortable for a few hours with food, drink and music. Tables and chairs are also available as well as numerous stools around the horseshoe-shaped bar. The appetizers we had were very good. Though we weren't flying anywhere, the airport was conveniently close for travelers--yet we heard no plane noise in our 3rd floor rooms. We stayed here because it was close to Seattle, the prices were far cheaper than Seattle and we didn't mind driving into the city for the crab rolls they wanted; there were queen-sized beds which worked for us, and we had a free breakfast. What more could you possibly want? I would definitely stay here again. But, if YOU stay there....please don't smuggle your yappy dogs into the room next to mine. Pay up and stay in the rooms allowed for pets!

Reviews.Title: “I won't "park and fly" anywhere else when flying out of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: BooBooPuppy
Reviews.Content: The staff are always polite, respectful, and accommodating. Our rooms have always been clean and spacious. The complimentary shampoos and soaps are awesome. I have never had a problem sleeping while staying at the Red Lion Hotel Seattle Airport, although it is located directly across the street from the airport. The neighboring restaurant has excellent food and service. We drop off our car in front of the lobby in a covered area so that we aren't exposed to the rain. It is waiting for us at the front door when we are ready to check out. The cost to stay is comparable to competing hotels in the area but the Red Lion service is far better. We have stayed at the Red Lion six or seven times when we've traveled from SEATAC. We know we can count on them.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: DavidAlan2
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and staff excellent. We were pleasantly surprised that the KIng Bed room was large enough that we could lay out four suitcases on the floor with room to comfortably move about. The water flow from the bathroom shower was minimal. All of this water conservation mentality means you have to suffer from low flow shower. This is not water pressure problem, it is one of insufficient flow. The tub drain was partially stopped up. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but they have an arrangement with a nearby restaurant and they provided us with free breakfast vouchers are part of the cost of our stay. If you arriving at the hotel in the late evening, we recommend bringing a bag lunch, because other food establishments are not conveniently close by. Hotel had a business center, which made printing out boarding passes convenient. Hotel has a shuttle service, but expect to be picked up and returned to a traffic island, and not at the front door of your airline counter. No significant airport noise because our room did not face airport.. We did not have a car, so did not have to pay their parking fee. The pluses for this hotel are that it is conveniently close to SEATAC, the shuttle was quick, the room was spacious and clean, and the bed was comfortable. We plan to use the hotel again on our next trip through SEATAC.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: coloradotraveler11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Red Lion Seatac in early May. I had checked the Trip Advisor reviews prior to making a reservation and found that about 25% had given this property a poor rating. So I made my reservation with "reservations". Our stay met expectations for a 3 star hotel. Bed resonably comfortable , OK linens and towells; we had booked through a third party at what I assume was a heavily discounted rate. I was looking for but did not see any evidence of the types of complaints other Trip Advisor reviewers had cited during recent stays about poor maintence, unclean rooms or outdated decorations/funrnishings. It was like I was in a completely different property.

Reviews.Title: “About what you'd expect from an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: didntwinthelotto
Reviews.Content: This was my first time seeing or staying at this hotel. I have to say I was pretty shocked upon pulling up in the parking lot...the hotel could best be called orange. WOW. I was a little nervous about what the inside would be like, but was pleasantly surprised. It had typical decor, amenities and rooms. I stay at Red Lion hotels pretty often and have found there to be a range of what they offer. I would say this one falls right in the middle. There were no glaring flaws (carpets were clean, room was average size, decor was farily modern) or amazing features (parking was outside, view was parking lot). We didn't eat at the restaurant which was in the parking lot, outside the hotel, so I can't weigh in on that. There was very little plane noise throughout the night, but I could hear some in the morning. But considering that this hotel is literally across the street from the airport, so that's to be expected. I was a little disapointed that I was charged $10 for outdoor, self parking. Perhaps this is an airport hotel standard. All in all, it was about what I would expect from an airport hotel...close, convenient, and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price.”
Reviews.Author: voodoomagic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably one of the closest to the airport, yet outside noise wasn't a problem. The room and bathroom were huge. There was a lot of noise from the plumbing, but wasn't a problem considering I only stayed for one night. The decor is very nice, without a floral carpet, or duvet anywhere in sight. They offer a no frills breakfast at the diner next door. They could use a few more light bulbs in the dining area. Overall, this place offers great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a night by the airport”
Reviews.Author: bw331
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Lion only for one night before moving to a hotel downtown. I was getting in late and I wanted a place close to the airport and Hotwire gave me the Red Lion for $54. They share a shuttle bus with a parking lot--Master Park Lot A (watch out, there are several different Master Park lots), so the shuttles come frequently. Check in took just a minute. ABC was not coming in on my TV in my room and this was a big problem for me since I had a football game to watch the next morning. I called the front desk and he sent someone up to move me to another room right away. I thought that was excellent service. The rooms were relatively large and clean. The internet was relatively good for hotel internet and it was free. I ordered room service for breakfast (they have a room service deal with the restaurant next store) and it came on-time and it was very good. When I called the front desk for a taxi, they recommended a town car instead, which was cheaper, so I was pleased about that. The only problem was that there was no hot water when I took a shower. This was unfortunate, but overall I was still pleased with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware room 208”
Reviews.Author: theskepticalone
Reviews.Content: Beware room 2008 and vicinity around the fitness center. We arrived late and all seemed to go as planned. Waited around 10 minutes for the shuttle at the airport (probably just missed the previous one). Check-in was painless enough and our room was clean/tidy/modern. At 4:00 am the room's alarm clock went off blaring. With our late arrival didn't think to check it. Then at 5:52 am, before the fitness center was even supposed to be open, some heavy adult male decides to run a half-marathon on the treadmill. Not only was it loud (walls are thin and even thinner when you SHARE A WALL WITH THE FITNESS CENTER) but the vibrations shook the bed and table. Ridiculous that this room is even offered as somewhere as any but a heavily discounted last resort. The clerk in the morning was clearly aware of the problem with this room but offered no further compensation (I can't get the sleep back anyway!) Would have been nice if the reception at night would have also received the memo. Will be following up for sure. Besides the inability for fatigued travellers to get a decent nights' sleep this would have been a nice stay to finish out our 19 day trip. Instead it was the low point of the trip by far. Not impressed and so cannot recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean but could be better. I will not stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kissaya
Reviews.Content: Short but sweet. The cleanliness is excellent, we didn't like the night waitress and shower stopper didn't work. So my husband and I couldn't take a hot bath together. When my husband took a shower he had to unscrew the stopper just to take a shower because then it stopped up the water!!! what the hell? We will not ever stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Space & Comfort...”
Reviews.Author: IceguyBlake
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are much nicer than we expected, for an airport hotel, that is generally used for overnight stays in order to catch early flights. We needed room for several nights as we explored the area. I most appreciated the free WiFi...& the convenience of rental cars, airport shuttle, restaurants and hotel location were essential. (just down the road from Southcenter Mall & Silver Dollar Casino) On business trips to Seattle, I often stay at the Double Tree Hotel next door, and the service, comfort & aminities are much better here at the Red Lion...

Reviews.Title: “Entirely Decent and Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: WandererDude
Reviews.Content: I searched for hours on the internet to find a reasonably priced, convenient, and comfortable hotel near SeaTac. The Red Lion fulfilled my expectations. It seems to be recently renovated and the rooms are clean and nicely furnished and include free wifi connection. Shuttle bus service got me to the hotel in five minutes. Front desk was friendly, efficient and helpful. I have no complaints and would highly recommend it, because it deserves to be noticed for its good effort at professional hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Hot as heck and lots of noise”
Reviews.Author: worldclassnonrever
Reviews.Content: The airline I work for put me up at this hotel for a couple of months, so I went a couple months with inadequate sleep. The people that work there are pretty nice usually. The shuttle service is amazing...now on to the not so good stuff. The AC does not work at all during the day time in the summer. I think it's just an old system and can't keep up. It works great at night though, even though you could just open a window. During the day it was hot and extremely stuffy. I had to call the front desk and ask for a fan, which they found one for me. It helped a little. This hotel is also extremely noisy. You might as well not have a door, you can hear everything that happens in the hallway. Also, you can hear all of your neighbors conversations among other things. If you just looking for a decent hotel near the airport at a reasonable price, I recommend the Holiday Inn Express down the road. I stayed there for a couple months also, much better!

Reviews.Title: “Full Service Hotel?? More like NO service...”
Reviews.Author: dcl80
Reviews.Content: I was put up in this place by my airline. I knew a little of the Red Lion hotel history, once a part of the Hilton Family for a short time, Hilton converted the good hotels to a Hilton or Doubletree then selling off the less appealing hotels. Well this is a less then appealing hotel. The check in staff was slow and clueless. I was given a room with 2 beds, I said it is just me, I only need 1 bed. She told be 1 bed is more money. OK.. I walk to my room, open the door and the smell of room was overwhelming, they had to use a can of spy to make it smell "good??" There was an old post-a-note on the floor, the lamp shade was not on straight, and just musty. The 2 beds were covered in the old hotel style, with a big smelly comforter, and thin sheets. There was no remote for the TV in the room, I called the desk and was told people take them. I A/C was loud and not very cooling. The bathroom was ok but small. They market themselves as a full service hotel, it reminds me of a super 8 when I walked in. the restaurant was an add on to the side and you have to go outside to get there.. The restaurant was like an IHOP. The staff was bad, no bell man to help with bags. No service not full service. The internet was free there is a positive. Over all there is so many other places to stay around SEA airport there is no reason to stay here. Oh and the person in the room above me uses the bathroom a lot. I can here it in my room..

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: inspiration100
Reviews.Content: Not much to complain about. The hotel is very clean, nice check in. Amazingly this hotel is very quiet too, even being next to the airport. Try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to SeaTac Airport with reliable shuttle”
Reviews.Author: SunnyMcBunny
Reviews.Content: I had never heard of a Red Lion Hotel chain before and was not sure what to expect, especially when i read some variable reviews on tripadvisor. However, this hotel exceeded my expectations. The room was very clean, had obviously been updated with granite desktops and countertops in the bathroom. I found the beds very comfy. We stayed here because we had an early morning flight and it was just perfect for that. They have a 24 hour free shuttle that departs every 10 minutes. This hotel is very close to airport. Here is a tip that saved us some money. Our last night in Seattle and we wanted to eat downtown. After dinner, instead of taking a taxi back to the Red Lion, we caught a Grayline Airport Shuttle for $11 each and then walked 5-10 min from airport to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: MHSW6
Reviews.Content: The Red Lion is located directly across the street from the seattle airport and is also a 10-15 minute ride to downtown seattle. The hotel was very clean and all the staff were very friendly. The outdoor pool was very large and had many lounge chairs and tables around it. The hot tub was located inside right next to the pool. The room was of high quality and the granite topped night stand and desk made the room look very attractive. We were lucky enough to get a room with a view of the lake behind the hotel which was really nice. The wireless internet was good but not excellent. There is a parking fee of 10 dollars a night which isn't too bad for seattle. We actually got this hotel through priceline and paid a very cheap rate. If in seattle again I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again, even for full price.

Reviews.Title: “Great start for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: hick50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after flying in a day before our Alaskan cruise.Very convenient to the airport,really didn't have to wait for the shuttle ,could have walked to the hotel. We had purchased a "snooze and cruise"package....room, breakfast,and a town car to the pier. Our room was large and comfortable (and quiet,even with the airport right across the street) Hot breakfast the next morning was in adjoining restaurant was very good. Staff was helpful .

Reviews.Title: “froze”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl1005
Reviews.Content: The Red Lion has recently remodeled this hotel. The rooms were very nice, the airport shuttle timely and the restaurant/bar convenient. My only problem was that our room was freezing cold. It was explained to me that the hotel had an older heating/cooling system that had to be turned on for the entire building. In other words there could be heat or air conditioning at any given time but not both. Since the day was warm, air conditioning had been turned on and heat was not available. As any Seattlite can tell you, nights are cold in Seattle. When I requested a space heater I was told none were available. When I requested blankets, I was told some would be up soon. None arrived. I would not stay here in the spring if you like to have a hotel room at the temperature of your choosing.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a quick night before a flight out”
Reviews.Author: Hawknoid
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean and adequate for a place to crash before flying out. The front desk was friendly and helpful. The hotel provided a free shuttle to the airport which was available the minute we needed it in the morning. It was nice to save a few extra bucks getting to the airport in the morning. Our only complaint would be the noise. Other guests and crying babies could be heard throughout the night. I guess the walls were pretty thin.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel option at the airport”
Reviews.Author: psSilverheart
Reviews.Content: Front desk efficient and courteous. Room was clean and comfortable but also a bit worn and tired looking. I needed help adjusting the heat and the front desk clerk knew exactly what to do. I had wanted a "stay and park" option - spend a night and get free parking while traveling. This hotel offers such a package, but there were none available the night of my stay. I understand that these offers can't be unlimited, but it's ironic - the hotel shares a property with one of the leading airport parking companies, so theoretically, unless the lot is full, there's always parking available. I did find that by using the parking company's (MasterPark) web coupon I could stay and park for 7 days for a price comparable to the hotel's stay and park package. The appeal of parking here is the security of a professional parking lot vs. parking on a hotel property with much more limited surveillance. I had noticed in other SeaTac hotel reviews that there is occasionally vandalism to cars while parked in hotel yards. Bottom line: stay here if you need to spend a night at the airport. No frills, but sufficiently comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Close to SeaTac”
Reviews.Author: MomVL
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel to Park & Fly. $75 for one week (and one day) parking booked through the hotel using email. Cheaper than booking straight with Masterpark.
