Very convenient free Masterpark shuttle loads up right in front of the hotel. Only a few minutes and you are at the airport. On our return our bus driver called in our reservation number (we should have done it ourselves earlier) and our vehicle was still ready for us when we showed up only minutes later. Excellent Service for a Park & Fly! The hotel is older - we booked two adjoining rooms. Got one for free with their "find a lower rate - we pay" promise. They even sent me a $100 gift card for a future stay!. The other room only cost $79 booking directly with the hotel (using email). A much better deal than I saw on their website. Our rooms were at the back and had a view of a little lake. There was no street or air traffic noise, but we could hear people next door in another adjoining room. Comfy beds. I read the review about the bed bugs... and I did notice three bites a few days later. Perhaps it's a coincidence? No-one else in our party was bitten. The hallways seem old and dingy. No free breakfast available! We didn't have time to dine before catching our flight, and I would have loved to grab a bite.

Reviews.Title: “Very good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: AThena53
Reviews.Content: We selected the Red Lion for an overnight before a flight early the next afternoon. Somehow I'd forgotten to print out my reservation confirmation and was a little edgy since it was pre-paid. Fortunately all was well in their records and we were soon in our room. I was very glad that the room was larger and more comfortable than many airport hotels since we slept in late and didn't check out till 11 AM. I agree with the good reviews on TripAdvisor and seem to have plenty of company- the valet parking booth had an entire wall of car keys from guests who must have used a park-and-fly plan. Amenities in the room were a cut above the usual discount hotel- they were from Bath and Body Works. There's a pool but it's outdoor; there's also a Fitness Center, which I didn't visit. The restaurant next to the hotel served a good breakfast but it was pricey ($25 for 2 people) and the portions were huge. We couldn't finish it all and when you're traveling it's usually impractical to take leftovers with you. There's free Wi-Fi in the rooms. It was very slow when I first tried it (took half an hour to connect and check 2 people in on-line) but the next morning it seemed to run faster. This was a very good choice for an overnight stay before our flight. Thanks to my fellow reviewers for your recommendations!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: hollywoodian
Reviews.Content: I have traveled the world and stayed in some remote small hotels that looked crummy. In all my travel years (30) I have never experienced bed bugs. I have now though after staying at this hotel for 1 night. I was so covered in bed bugs the next day you would not believe it. My flight was early morning and when I left the hotel I noticed that my back was itching allot. But I had to catch my flight so I just did not pay much attention. However when I finally boarded the flight the itching became worse. I went to the restroom and pulled up my shirt to look at why I was itching. To my horror I was covered in bites all over my back,stomach, legs. Lots of 3 bites in a row which is how the bed bugs bite. Awful. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near Seattle airport”
Reviews.Author: Joei
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Very efficient service. Great location for airport.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but ok stay”
Reviews.Author: yiujun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Lion for one night. The next day I left for LA from the Seattle Airport. We dropped off our car at Masterpark, as the hotel provides a free 7-day park n fly with one night's stay. We left our car there for 8 days, so I was charged for 10 days (apparently it's cheaper..). I was charged over 200 for the night incl parking. Looking back, I don't think I wouldve done it - quite pricey for one night's stay. Anyways, the parking was great, we got our car back safe and sound. The shuttle to and from the airport was convenient enough. The hotel itself looked pretty old and the lobby wasn't too nice looking. The room was comfortable, but looked sort of old. It was overall an OK experience.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hammurabi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Lion for three nights in June. Though close to the airport, airplane noise was not a problem. It appears to be a somewhat older hotel but is well maintained. The staff are helpful and friendly. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The only drawback was that it was difficult to adjust the water temperature in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great SEA-TEC Location”
Reviews.Author: Rebekajean
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a newer hotel instead of an older hotel that had been another chain in its past life. The good: excellent location, (across from SEA-TEC), free shuttle to airport, friendly staff, large clean rooms, plush pillows, nice eatery next door, very generous manager. The bad: unstable water temperature, bed had a ready made body indent so it was uncomfortable, room was stuffy and A/C would not cool it down. Unluckly for us, we only needed a room for one night and were looking for a comfortable bed and a nice shower in the morning before our very early flight back home. Because of our late arrival and early departure, we ended up calling the manager later the next day to let her know our situation. She responded quickly and we were offered a very generous rebate for our inconvenience so our opinion of Red Lion Hotels went up a notch. We would stay again if the price were right (under $100.00) and we could move to another room if the bed were uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “It is better than I expected after reading other reviews.”
Reviews.Author: TravelForFunDeerPark
Reviews.Content: I rated this hotel above average because of the price I paid. I bid on Priceline, and for $55 a night, it was worth it to me. The hotel has an older feel to it, but the rooms are large and bed comfy. We had a bit of a hard time keeping the room cool and the bathtub didn't want to drain. The hotel does not look like the picture, it is multi-colored now. There are nicer three star hotels in the area however, so I would look around. If you bid for a thee star and get this hotel and a good deal, it is a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelmyworld
Reviews.Content: Booked after reading reviews @hotels.com. Great loaction for downtown and to see all the sights Seattle has to offer. You do not need a car i easly walked every where. Clean and well decorated rooms. Complimentory coffee and fruit in the lobby of a morning. My room was on the 19th floor and i could see the city. Bar in the basement of the hotel does good local beers and good food at acceptable prices, vey busy on the Friday i was there. I would recomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. I'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: DavidInCambridgeUK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Red Lion at Sea-Tac in early December 2007. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room rate was very reasonable. The restaurant next door served an excellent breakfast, which was included in the "Roaring Start" room rate. Five stars to the Red Lion at Sea-Tac. We will stay there again whenever our travels take us through Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, thought we were at the old Red Lion but they changed locations”
Reviews.Author: TeBay
Reviews.Content: Although we have stayed in the Seattle area overnight for about 50 years we haven't used the Seattle airport hotel area for over a decade until now. We didn't realize that the original airport Red Lion had become the Double Tree. However, the price was right in October at their present location and the hotel was average. The restaurant was okay. But, we are overnighting again in early March and find their rates have almost doubled in the interim. So we booked into La Quinta at half the Red Lion's rate, in addition, comments and ratings in "Trip Advisor" give LaQuinta raving reviews compared to general opinion about Red Lion airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Seen Better Days”
Reviews.Author: bobemac
Reviews.Content: This was a Priceline stay, and it was rated 3*, This property has seen better days, like 25 years ago. It was nice once, I'm sure. Now, it's very dated with parts of old features still around. It was very close to the SeaTac airport. They don't have their own shuttle, you use one of the parking lot buses. There are four, I believe; A,B,C, and D. That's confusing, only one works. My room was large, but it had an irregular shape. Things all worked, but the bathroom was outmoded. The employees were OK, no one stood out. For a 3* property it did not make it. This Red Lion is 2.5* at best.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to avoid problems and was let down”
Reviews.Author: BummedOutinSeattle
Reviews.Content: I choose a more expensive hotel then some of the others hoping that I wouldn't have any of the problems that you normally experience when you book with the cheaper hotels - boy, was I wrong! The air conditioner worked for the first 10 minutes and that was the end of that. The staff said they had their maintenence guy on the roof fixing it, but it wasn't fixed the whole time I was there. After three calls to tell them how hot and stuffy it was, they finally provided me with a fan just so that I could sleep. The toliet didn't work properly. Flush it once and no more. We finally figured out you have to take off of the backside top cover, peer down into the tank to see what's causing it not to flush again, see nothing, put top cover back on, and guess what? it's ready to flush again. Too Weird !! I was informed that the TV satelite was out, so we couldn't watch any of the "free" channels that they say are included with the room. To be able to watch a movie we had to purchase it, at $12.00 per movie. Rip off all the way around ! The front desk clerks were okay, but not friendly. The pool was a total disappointment - small and it's behind the resturant. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere other than here.

Reviews.Title: “When a travel agent tells you not to go......”
Reviews.Author: AgentAdvisor
Reviews.Content: The Red Lion is a decent hotel with complimentary shuttles to the SeaTac airport, but their staff is incompetent beyond belief. Our room had been booked with 7 nights of free parking, so when they told me that was no longer an option and that I had to pay (in which case I would have just parked in the economy lot at the airport), I left a message with the manager to ask why it had been posted as free parking. When I hadn't heard back from the manager after not 1, not 2 but 4 messages on her answering machine over the course of 3 days, I became appalled at their lack of not only customer service, but lack of listening to a customer complaint. If you do decide to stay at the Red Lion, be aware that if you have a problem, it will fall on deaf ears.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: 1fun37
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Red Lion Inn after being denied a room elsewhere confirmed through Hotwire, needed a room at 10:30 PM and most all everywhere were booked. We found the rooms large, super comfortable and a staff that was extreemly helpfull. We refered the hotel the next day to friends who needed a room near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A Dive with some spa-like touches”
Reviews.Author: lmrboise
Reviews.Content: What a miserable night. My "non-smoking" room reeked of smoke, the toilet would only flush if I held down the handle for close to a minute, the room was very dark, even with every light turned on, and when I tried to work out in the tiny fitness room, the treadmill was broken. Everything was kind of dingy and I was extremely relieved to check out! They did put out some Bath and Body Works products and a nice robe, but it didn't come close to offsetting the bleak environment.

Reviews.Title: “Truely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jcall
Reviews.Content: Sorry that I only have one photo, I lost the other photos of the hotel :( . The location of the hotel is right on the main drag, international blvd and is literally right across the street from the airport. Very safe and clean area. I was at the hotel for business with the manager and also for leisure. When we arrived, parking was easy and FREE. The lobby was very nice and the people at the desk were very professional and helpful. The hotel has two elevators that service all floors and also goes to a basement where I think the underground parking was. We were given a room on the 5th floor, the top floor, and when we got to our room, the manager had three gift bags waiting for us on the desk. That showed us right there that they cared. I later met with the manager on schedule and thanked her for them. The rooms were very spacious, stylish, and clean. Great after a long day downtown. We had a small issue with our bedspread so we left a note for Mary, the housekeeper. The next day it was changed and she left a note apologizing for the issue. We felt that it was taken care of properly, quickly, and with class. Thank you Mary! We didn't get a chance to eat in the restaurant, but heard that it was very good. The pool area was very nice, but could use just a little bit of updating. The hot tub was very spacious and warm with a view of the outdoor pool. Great for a cool day in Seattle. Overall, the best of the airport hotels. Great location, caring and courteous staff, and best of all, spotless! When we return to Seattle, we will certainly stay here. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Not just Comfortable, CLEAN, Elegant, Safe and Great Room Service....A++ STAFF”
Reviews.Author: RJOTCJS
Reviews.Content: You know how it is when you are a Mother traveling with your eleven-year-old adorable (or so you thought) son, (who by the way, is a little person/dwarf = center of attention) and you go to another state, you've not been to before and you don't expect the worst things to happen to you i.e. lost luggage/tampered w/ luggage, and after 2 hours of wandering around baggage wondering what the heck happened to your baggage that never showed up...you finally lose it and report the insanity that is baggage claim!!!!! (THERE HAS GOT TO BE A BETTER WAY! AM I RIGHT?) you get to that little phone that calls the shuttle to the place you have reservations for the next six days, and you think .... It's only going to get worse? Well, let me tell you. If it weren't for the fact that I picked up the phone and to my amazement, the shuttle was right there in front of us ready to take us with our carry-on (3 bags) only - fretting, stewing and etc., and you are whisked away to a "Shangrila" that is so accomodating in every way, that the fact that your meds you need to function are missing, plus, plus, plus...just seems to melt away. I LOVE THIS FACILITY.....FIRST RATE ROOMS (Just don't look at the carpeting in the hallways, it is a bit busy) but you get to your room, modern decor, amenities, the best pool and the largest spa/jacuzzi area - reahabilitating! Pillow top bed you never want to get out of, cable television w/ movies and NINTENDO lifesaver...But that's just the beginning. I had one crisis after another as we were attending a conference at the Hotel next door (boy am I glad I didn't get a room there!) and I physically was ill, no meds, had to go to er, back and forth and I never had a more enjoyable stay anywhere and I've traveled quite alot - abroad - five star...but this facility is clean, safe, food was great! (pricey, but you get what you pay for) but I have to say this, THE STAFF IS INCOMPARABLE! From the angels of mercy at the front desk to the angels that keep the rooms so sparkling clean and stocked with whatever, they are available when you need them - they don't put you on their schedule..I was never treated better and I have to tell all you "Nervous Nellies and Mother's traveling with children" this place really makes you feel like you are the only ones there - and the place was booked up!) I will recommend this property to any and everyone! Bear in mind, this is the Red Lion, Seattle Airport .. just so we are on the same page as they had another property within 9 miles of this one, so make no mistake, RED LION, SEA TAC - Thanks for the TLC..I will be back if you will let us!

Reviews.Title: “Run down and dirty. Not what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: Travelscheap
Reviews.Content: We used Priceline to book this hotel and since our rate was about 40% off the regular rate I didn't feel the need to complain. However, this was the worst Red Lion I have stayed in. It was run down and dirty. The room reminded me of a budget motel. The Priceline star level was 3 star upscale and frankly I found it to be a 1 or at best a 2. Needless to say, we were dissapointed. complained to Priceline about the star rating but as I said, did not feel the need to say anything to the hotel. I just feel bad for those people who spend $120 plus dollars there.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed at the Red Lion”
Reviews.Author: CEQUAS
Reviews.Content: Due to airline problems, I had to stay an extra night in Seattle, and the airline put me up in the Red Lion. I had never stayed at one of these hotels before, so I was a little apprehensive. While the front desk clerk was not the friendliest person on earth, she wasn't entirely rude either. The room was wonderful, spacious, clean, nice bathroom. It allowed me to relax under otherwise stressful conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: icedog114
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this hotel! It is old and showing its age. Stayed here one night because of a missed flight and wish I would have stayed at the Radison next door. The hotel has walls so thin you can hear your neighbor snore next door. There was a breeze that night and the wind caused the windows to howel. Water in the shower would not stay a constant temperature and the staff at the front desk was less than wiling to help with any of your needs.

Reviews.Title: “ParkNFly Beware”
Reviews.Author: whatgoeswrongwill
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed at many ParkNFly hotels in the Seattle area. This is the first time we encountered miscommunication regarding when the number of days for parking actually begin. This hotel has "packages" 7-day & 10-day parking for a fee with 1-night stay. (Previous hotels actually had "free parking") We were leaving 10/14 @ 6AM for Puerto Vallarta, Mexico travelling thru SanFrancisco & returning on 10/21 @ 11:30pm. When we checked in on the 13th, we paid the upgrade fee for 7-days of parking, "MasterPark" employees parked the car. Unbeknownst to us, our 1st day began the 13th when we checked in because they parked the car that evening. We should have parked the car in the Hotel parking lot for that evening, then handed the keys over in the morning, 3:30am prior to taking the shuttle over. However, while waiting for the shuttle we spoke to another party staying at the hotel & evidently someone had left their luggage in the car overnight in the hotel parking lot & it was missing the next morning. So...do not leave your luggage in the parked car!!! Needless to say, our return flight was delayed; we arrived at 12:05am at Seatac & to the hotel approx. 12:40am. Technically we were in the 9th day, so they charged us $16.99!!!! for each day over the 7. In summary, beware of ParkNFly offers that are not actually initiated & run by the hotel, the hotel staff may not be trained adequately. Clarify the exact dates included for parking with the parking company or hotel & have it in writing & initialed by the staff. Never leave luggage in parked vehicle. I feel very strongly that I couldn't possibly be the first guest to have this happen, hopefully it won't happen to future guests.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job!”
Reviews.Author: CVN-65
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business recently (Sept 2006) and found this hotel ideally located if you're here for a short business trip. The airport is only a 5-10 minute walk away and a trip to downtown Seattle is only about 30 minutes away (using the Seattle Express $12 service). Gregory's Grill serves some good food and the bar offers some evening entertainment (although I missed the Tuesday karaoke!). There is a pool and jacuzzi / sauna but I didn't use either. The pool looked ok but the jacuzzi area could do with a tidy up. Overall, a pretty good hotel and better, in my opinion than the Holiday Inn which I stayed at in August 2006.

Reviews.Title: “thin walls - might as well just open up that connecting door”
Reviews.Author: 2ez4me
Reviews.Content: The light switch didn't work in the room but not a big deal, just had to use the side table lamps. The biggest complaint was the door connecting to the room next to us. We could hear everything down to the person coughing and moving around on his bed. I'm not sure why these doors still exist. Bring some earplugs. Ate at Gregor's, the hotel restaurant next door. Very shabby place, doesn't look like it's been renovated since 1970 but surprising decent food, that is until we found the fly in my girlfriend's salad, still alive stuck in the dressing. The waitress was friendly and helpful though, comped us the salad and a dessert. Had room service deliver breakfast. I had 2 eggs, bacon, english muffin, 2 pancakes, juice. My girlfriend - granola in yogurt w/berries, oj. total bill - $28 :-(
